Package io.github.ai4ci.flow.mechanics

Class Updater

java.lang.Object
io.github.ai4ci.flow.mechanics.Updater
public class Updater extends Object
The updater is the main handler of the update cycle. It contains the hard coded bits of the update cycle and configurable aspects can be added with person processors and outbreak processors which can be created with withPersonProcessor(Predicate, TriConsumer) or withOutbreakProcessor(Predicate, TriConsumer) and pre-canned update configurations are found in the ModelUpdate class.

Within the update process at each time step the contact network is determined by the contactNetwork(Outbreak) method. This is the key determinant of exposures, from social network connections and, if supported, venue driven connections.

The updater follows the following process:
  • prepareUpdate: Creates a Ephemeral OutbreakState and PersonState builder in Outbreak and each Person respectively, from the current state. This will be used to process state changes and will become the current state at the next time point. Similarly creates a OutbreakHistory and PersonHistory builder from the current states, using HistoryMapper. These will become the historical record of the current state at the original time point. At this point the head of the history list still points to the previous day (t-1) and the current state to (t).
  • updateHistory: This stage is responsible for filling in events that can be regarded as happening at the end of the day (t). Firstly the contacts made during the day are simulated and recorded, depending on the state of the agents. Secondly updates are made to the model as defined by policy and behaviours. This mostly includes updating agents with records of the testing performed during the current day (t). This is done by the end of day function in the the behaviour state (see State.BehaviourState) which implements an updateHistory hook for person histories, and in the policy state (see State.PolicyState) which implements an updateHistory hook for outbreak histories. At the end of this stage the head of the history list points to the original previous day (t-1) and the current state is still at the original day (t).
    The updateHistory phase first operates on the Outbreak and then on each Person in the simulation.
  • switchHistory: At this point the head of the OutbreakHistory list and PersonHistory lists are updated to point to the copy created from the current state in the last step. After this point the head of the history list points to the same day (t) as the current state (t).
  • updateState: The second phase of the updates is focussed on changes that happen at the start of the next day (t+1). For all agents their in host viral load model is updated with information about any exposures that happened in the previous day (t) and the model advanced one time step top (t+1). Similarly based on observed contacts, and their observed risks and test results the per agent risk model is updated to represent what each agent could know about their risk at time (t+1) based on information up to and including time (t). Behavioural changes are then applied using the behaviour state's nextState hook (State.BehaviourState), and in the policy state via its nextState hook (State.PolicyState). State implementations use the context and RNG to decide the next state and may mutate the supplied builders where necessary.

    When using this care must be taken to recognise that the first day in history is the current day that is being updated (t). After this the current state is still at time (t) and the head of the history list at time (t) - however the agents in host viral load and risk models are already updated to (t+1).
    The updateState phase first operates on the Outbreak and then on each Person in the simulation.
  • switchState: At this point the current states of the outbreak (t) or agents is switched to point to the newly created future state representing the next day in the simulation (t+1). When this happens the simulation day counter is effectively incremented. After this point the head of an agents history list points to the previous day (t) and the current state is referring to (t+1) (including in host and risk models)

  • Method Details

    • asExposure

      public static Optional<Exposure> asExposure(Contact contact, PersonState infectee, PersonState infector)
      Generate an exposure from a contact event between an potential infector and an infectee. This is where the probability of transmission is applied to determine whether a contact results in an exposure. If it does, the amount of exposure is determined by the infector's viral load. The infector is only considered if they are currently infectious, as determined by their in-host model. If the infector is not infectious, no exposure occurs regardless of the contact. If the infector is infectious, the probability of transmission is calculated by combining the infector's transmissibility and the infectee's susceptibility modifier, which are combined using an odds ratio scaling function. The resulting exposure is represented as an Exposure object, which includes the ID of the infector and the amount of exposure. If the contact does not result in an exposure, an empty Optional is returned. This method is a key part of the transmission process in the model, linking social interactions (contacts) to potential infection events (exposures).
      Parameters:
      contact - the contact event
      infectee - the person who may be infected
      infector - the person who may be infectious
      Returns:
      an Optional containing the Exposure if transmission occurs, or empty if not

    • contactNetwork

      public static PersonStateContacts contactNetwork(Outbreak outbreak)
      Build the contact network for a specific outbreak day.
      Parameters:
      outbreak - the simulation
      Returns:
      a PersonStateContacts data structure with contacts and exposures for every individual in the model (potentially empty).

    • update

      public Outbreak update(Outbreak outbreak)
      The main update method is called to advance the simulation by one day.
      Parameters:
      outbreak - a simulation to update
      Returns:
      the same outbreak with new states and histories

    • withOutbreakProcessor

      public Updater withOutbreakProcessor(Predicate<Outbreak> test, ModelOperation.TriConsumer<io.github.ai4ci.abm.ImmutableOutbreakState.Builder,Outbreak,Sampler> updater)
      This method allows you to add a outbreak processor to the update cycle. Outbreak processors are the final step to be run in updating an outbreak immediately before the agents in the outbreak are updated. When they operate the head of the history list will be at time (t) and the current state will also refer to time (t). However the policy state machine state will reflect time (t+1).
      Parameters:
      test - A predicate that test whether the outbreak should be updated. This could for example be a time based filter.
      updater - An 3 parameter function referring to a outbreak state, the current state, and a RNG sampler. An example here could change the transmissibility of the outbreak at a set time.
      Returns:
      The updater ( a fluent method)
      See Also:
      • withOutbreakProcessors(OutbreakStateUpdater...)

    • withOutbreakProcessors

      public Updater withOutbreakProcessors(ModelOperation.OutbreakStateUpdater... updaters)
      Outbreak processors are the final step to be run in updating an outbreak immediately before the agents in the outbreak are updated. When they operate the head of the history list will be at time (t) and the current state will also refer to time (t). However the policy state machine state will reflect time (t+1).
      Parameters:
      updaters - see ModelOperation.updateOutbreakState(Predicate, TriConsumer)
      Returns:
      the updater as a fluent method

    • withPersonProcessor

      public Updater withPersonProcessor(Predicate<Person> test, ModelOperation.TriConsumer<io.github.ai4ci.abm.ImmutablePersonState.Builder,Person,Sampler> updater)
      This method allows you to add a person processor to the update cycle. Person processors are the final step to be run in updating an person immediately before the final update. When they operate the head of the history list will be at time (t) and the current state will also refer to time (t). The in host model and risk model will have been updated to (t+1) but this will not yet have been applied to the current state. However the behaviour state machine state will reflect time (t+1).
      Parameters:
      test - A predicate that test whether the person should be updated
      updater - An 3 parameter function referring to a person state, the current state, and a RNG sampler.
      Returns:
      The updater ( a fluent method)
      See Also:
      • withPersonProcessors(PersonStateUpdater...)

    • withPersonProcessors

      public Updater withPersonProcessors(ModelOperation.PersonStateUpdater... updaters)
      Person processors are the final step to be run in updating an person immediately before the final update. When they operate the head of the history list will be at time (t) and the current state will also refer to time (t). The in host model and risk model will have been updated to (t+1) but this will not yet have been applied to the current state. However the behaviour state machine state will reflect time (t+1).
      Parameters:
      updaters - see ModelOperation.updatePersonState(Predicate, TriConsumer)
      Returns:
      the updater as a fluent method
